But it was started on port 7001.  :-(  ????

-----Original Message-----
From: Scott Stirling [mailto:scottstirling@...]
Sent: Saturday, April 19, 2003 5:34 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] Re: ServerTestCase


> From: scohan2005 [mailto:scohan@...]
[...]
> javax.naming.CommunicationException [Root exception is
> java.net.ConnectException: t3://localhost:7001: Destinati
> on unreachable; nested exception is:
>         java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect; No
> available router to destination]
>
> This is the exception that I got when using ant to compile and run the
> junit test.  I started running the test from a dos prompt calling
> java, because that was how I got the ExampleServerTestCase to run.
> But I eventually got back to this error (I guess because the other
> code that I call is running outside the app server.)
>
> How can I get around this?

Seems like you need to start Weblogic.  How do you expect the JNDI listener
in Weblogic to respond if it's not running?  Of course it also has to be
running on port 7001, which is the default for Weblogic.

Scott S.
